addMedicalRecord(address,string,bytes32,.details: Called by whitelisted hospitals after uploading encrypted data to IPFS.       Record status starts as unverified (pending validator approval).

params._dataHash: SHA-256 hash of the original data for integrity
params._ipfsCid: The IPFS Content Identifier of the encrypted data

returns.recordIndex: The index of the newly added record  Requirements: - Caller must be a whitelisted hospital - Patient must be registered - Data hash must be unique (no duplicates)  Emits: - {RecordAdded} event

approve(address,uint256).details: Always reverts as Soulbound tokens cannot be approved for transfer

approveAccessRequest(uint256).details: Grants access to the requesting hospital

params._requestIndex: Index of the request to approve  Requirements: - Caller must be the patient - Request must exist and be pending  Emits: - {AccessRequestApproved} event - {AccessGranted} event

balanceOf(address).details: Returns the number of tokens in ``owner``'s account.

checkAccess(address,address).details: Public view function for hospitals/validators to verify access

returns.hasAccess: True if access is valid and not expired

constructor.details: Sets up the ERC-721 token with name and symbol, grants admin role to deployer

params._hospitalRegistry: Optional address of AutomatedHospitalRegistry (can be address(0))
params._trustedForwarder: Address of the ERC-2771 trusted forwarder for gasless transactions

getAccessGrantMessageHash(address,addres.details: Frontend can use this to create the message for patient to sign

params._nonce: A unique nonce to prevent replay attacks

returns._0: The message hash to be signed
requests Array of all access requests (including processed ones)

getActiveAccessors(address).details: Filters out expired and revoked permissions

returns._0: activeAccessors List of addresses with active access

getApproved(uint256).details: Returns the account approved for `tokenId` token. Requirements: - `tokenId` must exist.

getGrantedAccessList(address).details: Useful for patients to view who has access to their data

returns._0: List of accessor addresses (may include revoked/expired)

getPatientId(address).details: Returns 0 if the patient is not registered

returns._0: The patient ID (0 if not registered)

getPatientRecords(address).details: View function for patients to see their complete medical history

returns._0: pendingRequests Array of pending access requests
The MedicalRecordRef at the specified index

getRecordsByHospital(address,address).details: Useful for viewing records from a specific healthcare provider

params._hospital: The hospital address to filter by

returns._0: filteredRecords Array of records from the specified hospital

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantAccess(address,string,uint256).details: Only the patient (data owner) can grant access to their data.       Supports temporary access with expiration timestamp.

params._accessor: The address of the hospital/doctor to grant access
params._expiresAt: Unix timestamp when access expires (0 = permanent until revoked)  Requirements: - Caller must be a registered patient - Accessor must be a whitelisted hospital - If expiry is set, it must be in the future  Emits: - {AccessGranted} event

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

returns._0: True if the wallet has a patient identity

isApprovedForAll(address,address).details: Returns if the `operator` is allowed to manage all of the assets of `owner`. See {setApprovalForAll}

isHospitalAuthorized(address).details: Public view function for external contracts/frontends to verify hospital status

returns._0: True if hospital is authorized from any source

isTrustedForwarder(address).details: Indicates whether any particular address is the trusted forwarder.

mintIdentity(address).details: Called by the system during patient onboarding. Creates a unique,       non-transferable NFT that serves as the patient's identity.

params._patientWallet: The wallet address of the patient

returns.patientId: The unique patient ID assigned  Requirements: - Caller must have ADMIN_ROLE or HOSPITAL_ROLE - Patient wallet must not already have an identity - Patient wallet must not be zero address  Emits: - {IdentityMinted} event - Standard ERC-721 {Transfer} event

ownerOf(uint256).details: Returns the owner of the `tokenId` token. Requirements: - `tokenId` must exist.

params._requestIndex: Index of the request to reject  Requirements: - Caller must be the patient - Request must exist and be pending  Emits: - {AccessRequestRejected} event

removeHospitalFromWhitelist(address).details: Only admins can remove hospitals from whitelist

params._hospital: The hospital's wallet address  Requirements: - Caller must have ADMIN_ROLE  Emits: - {HospitalRemovedFromWhitelist} event

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

requestAccess(address,string,uint256,str.details: Creates a pending access request that patient must approve

params._accessDuration: Requested access duration in seconds (0 = until revoked)
params._hospitalName: Name of the hospital for display
params._message: Optional message explaining why access is needed  Requirements: - Patient must be registered - Hospital must be whitelisted - No existing pending request from this hospital  Emits: - {AccessRequested} event
params._patient: The patient's wallet address (from QR code)

revokeAccess(address).details: Only the patient (data owner) can revoke access to their data

params._accessor: The address of the hospital/doctor to revoke access from  Requirements: - Caller must be a registered patient - Access must have been previously granted  Emits: - {AccessRevoked} event

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256.details: Safely transfers `tokenId` token from `from` to `to`, checking first that contract recipients are aware of the ERC-721 protocol to prevent tokens from being forever locked. Requirements: - `from` cannot be the zero address. - `to` cannot be the zero address. - `tokenId` token must exist and be owned by `from`. - If the caller is not `from`, it must have been allowed to move this token by either {approve} or   {setApprovalForAll}. - If `to` refers to a smart contract, it must implement {IERC721Receiver-onERC721Received}, which is called upon   a safe transfer. Emits a {Transfer} event.

Safely transfers `tokenId` token from `from` to `to`. Requirements: - `from` cannot be the zero address. - `to` cannot be the zero address. - `tokenId` token must exist and be owned by `from`. - If the caller is not `from`, it must be approved to move this token by either {approve} or {setApprovalForAll}. - If `to` refers to a smart contract, it must implement {IERC721Receiver-onERC721Received}, which is called upon   a safe transfer. Emits a {Transfer} event.

selfRegister().details: This is the self-registration function for patients. Creates a unique,      non-transferable NFT that serves as the patient's identity.

returns.patientId: The unique patient ID assigned  Requirements: - Caller must not already have an identity  Emits: - {IdentityMinted} event - Standard ERC-721 {Transfer} event

setApprovalForAll(address,bool).details: Always reverts as Soulbound tokens cannot have operator approvals

setHospitalRegistry(address).details: Only admins can update this. Set to address(0) to disable external registry check.

params._hospitalRegistry: The address of the AutomatedHospitalRegistry contract

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Override required for AccessControl and ERC721 compatibility

returns._0: True if the interface is supported

tokenURI(uint256).details: Returns the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) for `tokenId` token.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: Transfers `tokenId` token from `from` to `to`. WARNING: Note that the caller is responsible to confirm that the recipient is capable of receiving ERC-721 or else they may be permanently lost. Usage of {safeTransferFrom} prevents loss, though the caller must understand this adds an external call which potentially creates a reentrancy vulnerability. Requirements: - `from` cannot be the zero address. - `to` cannot be the zero address. - `tokenId` token must be owned by `from`. - If the caller is not `from`, it must be approved to move this token by either {approve} or {setApprovalForAll}. Emits a {Transfer} event.

trustedForwarder().details: Returns the address of the trusted forwarder.

verifyPatientSignature(address,bytes32,b.details: Used for off-chain authorization verification (e.g., QR code scanning)

params._messageHash: The hash of the message that was signed

returns._0: True if the signature is valid and from the patient

verifyRecord(address,uint256).details: Called by the validator system after successful verification

params._recordIndex: The index of the record to verify  Requirements: - Caller must have ADMIN_ROLE (representing validator consensus) - Record index must be valid  Emits: - {RecordVerified} event

params._hospitalName: The name/identifier of the hospital  Requirements: - Caller must have ADMIN_ROLE - Hospital address must not be zero  Emits: - {HospitalWhitelisted} event

addMedicalRecord(address,string,bytes32,.notice: Adds a new medical record reference for a patient

checkAccess(address,address).notice: Checks if an accessor has valid (non-expired) access to patient data

constructor.notice: Initializes the Medichain Patient Identity contract

getAccessGrantMessageHash(address,addres.notice: Generates an access grant message hash for signing

getAccessRequests(address).notice: Returns all pending access requests for a patient

getActiveAccessors(address).notice: Returns list of all active (non-expired, non-revoked) accessors

getGrantedAccessList(address).notice: Returns list of all addresses granted access by a patient

getPatientId(address).notice: Gets the patient ID for a given wallet address

getPatientRecords(address).notice: Gets all medical record references for a patient

getPendingAccessRequestCount(address).notice: Returns the count of pending access requests for a patient

getPendingAccessRequests(address).notice: Returns only pending access requests for a patient

getRecordByIndex(address,uint256).notice: Gets a specific medical record by index

getRecordCount(address).notice: Gets the total number of records for a patient

getRecordsByHospital(address,address).notice: Gets records filtered by hospital address

getTotalPatients().notice: Gets the total number of registered patients

grantAccess(address,string,uint256).notice: Grants access permission to a hospital/doctor address

hasPatientIdentity(address).notice: Checks if a wallet has a registered patient identity

hospitalRegistry().notice: Reference to the external Hospital Registry contract

isHospitalAuthorized(address).notice: Checks if a hospital is authorized (from local whitelist OR external registry)

isWhitelistedHospital(address).notice: Whitelisted hospitals mapping for quick lookup

mintIdentity(address).notice: Mints a new Soulbound patient identity NFT (admin/hospital only)

patientIdToWallet(uint256).notice: Mapping from patient ID to wallet address (reverse lookup)

recordHashExists(bytes32).notice: Tracking of unique data hashes to prevent duplicates

removeHospitalFromWhitelist(address).notice: Removes a hospital from the whitelist

requestAccess(address,string,uint256,str.notice: Hospital requests access to a patient's data (called after scanning QR)

revokeAccess(address).notice: Revokes access permission from a hospital/doctor address

selfRegister().notice: Allows a patient to register themselves and mint their own identity NFT

setHospitalRegistry(address).notice: Sets or updates the external Hospital Registry contract address

supportsInterface(bytes4).notice: Checks if the contract supports an interface

verifyPatientSignature(address,bytes32,b.notice: Verifies that a message was signed by the patient

verifyRecord(address,uint256).notice: Marks a medical record as verified by validators

walletToPatientId(address).notice: Mapping from wallet address to patient ID (NFT token ID)

whitelistHospital(address,string).notice: Adds a hospital to the whitelist
